meanings.definition: The quality of being new, original, or unusual.
meanings.sent1: The novelty of the shiny toy caught the child's attention.
meanings.sent2: The novelty of the invention impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The novelty of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her unique fashion sense was a novelty in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The novelty of the snowfall in June was unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A small and inexpensive toy or trinket.
meanings.sent1: The kids enjoyed playing with the novelty they won at the fair.
meanings.sent2: She bought a novelty keychain as a souvenir from the gift shop.
meanings.sent3: The novelty on the shelf made the room feel cozy.
meanings.sent4: The novelty on the desk added a touch of whimsy to the office.
meanings.sent5: The novelty in the vending machine caught his eye.

meanings.definition: A new or unfamiliar experience or situation.
meanings.sent1: The novelty of traveling to a foreign country excited her.
meanings.sent2: Experiencing the novelty of skydiving was exhilarating.
meanings.sent3: The novelty of trying a new food made him nervous.
meanings.sent4: The novelty of starting a new job brought a mix of emotions.
meanings.sent5: The novelty of the haunted house tour gave her chills.
